abstract: A table of data for training or evaluating a machine learning model.
overview:
## Overview

[doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataTable] is Create ML’s version of a spreadsheet in which each row represents an entity (such as a book, in the example below) with observable features. Each column ([doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataColumn] or [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLUntypedColumn]) in the table represents an observable feature of that entity, such as a book’s title or author.



In most cases you interact with columns using the typed [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataColumn], especially when you need to directly access the contents of a column. You can also interact with columns using [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLUntypedColumn], if the underlying type of the column isn’t important.

After you create a data table, you can modify it with methods like [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataTable/append(contentsOf:)], [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataTable/addColumn(_:named:)-kkbw], and [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataTable/removeColumn(named:)]. You can also filter or map the contents of the data table to derive new data tables or new columns by using various subscripts and methods like [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataTable/dropDuplicates()] or [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataTable/map(_:)-92wrj].

Finally, when your data table is ready, use it to train and evaluate a model from these groups:

---

# MLDataTable

**Structure**

A table of data for training or evaluating a machine learning model.

## Declaration

```swift
struct MLDataTable
```

## Overview

[doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataTable] is Create ML’s version of a spreadsheet in which each row represents an entity (such as a book, in the example below) with observable features. Each column ([doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataColumn] or [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLUntypedColumn]) in the table represents an observable feature of that entity, such as a book’s title or author.



In most cases you interact with columns using the typed [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataColumn], especially when you need to directly access the contents of a column. You can also interact with columns using [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLUntypedColumn], if the underlying type of the column isn’t important.

After you create a data table, you can modify it with methods like [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataTable/append(contentsOf:)], [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataTable/addColumn(_:named:)-kkbw], and [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataTable/removeColumn(named:)]. You can also filter or map the contents of the data table to derive new data tables or new columns by using various subscripts and methods like [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataTable/dropDuplicates()] or [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataTable/map(_:)-92wrj].



Finally, when your data table is ready, use it to train and evaluate a model from these groups:

- Regressors like [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLRegressor] and its supporting types
- Classifiers like [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLClassifier] and its supporting types
- Natural language processing types like [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLTextClassifier] and [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLWordTagger]



## Creating a data table

- **Creating a model from tabular data**: Train a machine learning model by using Core ML to import and manage tabular data.
- **init(contentsOf:options:)**: Creates a data table from an imported JSON or CSV file.
- **init(dictionary:)**: Creates a data table from a dictionary of column names and data values.
- **init(namedColumns:)**: Creates a data table from a dictionary of column names and untyped columns.
- **init()**: Creates an empty table containing no rows or columns.
- **MLDataTable.ParsingOptions**: The options for parsing a comma-separated values (CSV) file into a data table for a machine learning model.

## Getting the size of a data table

- **size**: The number of rows and columns in the data table.

## Transforming rows to generate a data column

- **map(_:)**: Creates a new column by applying a given thread-safe transform to every row in the data table.

## Adding columns

- **addColumn(_:named:)**: Adds an untyped column to the table.
- **MLDataColumn**: A column of typed values in a data table.
- **MLUntypedColumn**: A column of untyped values in a data table.

## Accessing columns

- **subscript(_:)**: Retrieves or adds an untyped column with the specified name.
- **subscript(_:_:)**: Retrieves a column with the specified name and type.

## Renaming columns

- **renameColumn(named:to:)**: Changes the name of an existing column.

## Removing columns

- **removeColumn(named:)**: Removes the column with the specified name.

## Appending to a data table

- **append(contentsOf:)**: Appends the contents of the given data table to the end of this data table.

## Generating new data tables

- **Data table derivation operations**: Create new data tables by manipulating an existing data table.

## Splitting a data table

- **randomSplitBySequence(proportion:by:on:seed:)**
- **stratifiedSplit(proportions:on:generator:)**: Randomly split a MLDataTable into a number partitions while stratifying on a user-define label column.
- **stratifiedSplit(proportions:on:seed:)**: Randomly split a MLDataTable into a number partitions while stratifying on a user-define label column.
- **stratifiedSplitBySequence(proportions:by:on:generator:)**: Randomly split a MLDataTable into partitions on a user-define label column, while keeping rows from the same sequence in the original order.
- **stratifiedSplitBySequence(proportions:by:on:seed:)**: Randomly split a MLDataTable into partitions on a user-define label column, while keeping rows from the same sequence in the original order.

## Getting information about a data table’s rows

- **MLDataTable.Row**: A row of untyped values in a data table.
- **rows**: The rows of data in the table.
- **MLDataTable.Rows**: A collection of rows in a data table.

## Getting information about a data table’s columns

- **columnNames**: The names of the columns in the data table.
- **MLDataTable.ColumnNames**: A collection of the names of the columns in a data table.
- **columnTypes**: The type of the data in each column.

## Saving a data table

- **write(to:)**: Exports a binary file of the data table to the given directory URL.
- **write(toDirectory:)**: Exports a binary file of the data table to the given directory path.
- **writeCSV(to:)**: Exports a CSV file of the data table to the given directory URL.
- **writeCSV(toFile:)**: Exports a CSV file of the data table to the given directory path.

## Visualizing a data table

- **show()**: Generates a visualization for the data in the table.

## Describing a data table

- **description**: A text representation of the data table.
- **playgroundDescription**: A description of the data table shown in a playground.

## Handling data table errors

- **isValid**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the data table is valid.
- **error**: The underlying error present when the data table is invalid.

## Default Implementations

- **CustomPlaygroundDisplayConvertible Implementations**
- **CustomStringConvertible Implementations**

## Tabular data

- **MLDataValue**: The value of a cell in a data table.
- **Data visualizations**: Render images of data tables and columns in a playground.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- CustomPlaygroundDisplayConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
